intro: Eritrichium brachytubum, commonly known as the short-tubed eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Its small, tubular flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eritrichium brachytubum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
